Package abalone

Class MoveCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • abalone.MoveCheck
  • public class MoveCheck
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that checks whether the given indexes are a valid move on the board, based on the current marble and board status. Returns an ArrayList with all indexes that should be moved if valid, if not valid the class returns specific IllegalMoveExceptions.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ayla en Sam

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor receives values for the marble color and the current board status.

      • moveChecker

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> moveChecker​(int i1,
                                                          java.lang.String direction)
                                                   throws IllegalMoveException
        adds the given indexs to an arraylist, sorts them and finalizes the list by adding hidden summito marbles when a player enters less than the total amount of marbles to be moved. Finally the full list is compared to valid moves and sends back all the marbles that should be moved.
        Parameters:
        i1 - the first index as an input
        direction - the direction as an input
        Returns:
        ArrayList with valid moves
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if index is not on the board
        Requires
        i1 != null, direction is valid direction
        Ensures
        0 < index && index <= 6

        adds the given indices to an ArrayList, sorts them and finalizes the list by adding hidden summito marbles when a player enters less than the total amount of marbles to be moved. Finally the full list is compared to valid moves and sends back all the marbles that should be moved.
        Parameters:
        i1 - the first index as an input
        i2 - the second index as an input
        direction - the direction as an input
        Returns:
        ArrayList with valid moves
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if the index is not on the board
        Requires
        i1, i2 != null, direction is a valid direction
        Ensures
        0 < index && index <= 6

      • moveChecker

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> moveChecker​(int i1,
                                                          int i2,
                                                          int i3,
                                                          int i4,
                                                          java.lang.String direction)
                                                   throws IllegalMoveException
        adds the given indices to an ArrayLit, sorts them and finalizes the list by adding hidden summito marbles when a player enters less than the total amount of marbles to be moved. Finally the full list is compared to valid moves and sends back all the marbles that should be moved.
        Parameters:
        i1 - the first index as input
        i2 - the second index as input
        i3 - the third index as input
        i4 - the fourth index as input
        direction - the direction as input
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with valid moves
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if index is not on board
        Requires
        i1, i2, i3, i4 != null, direction is valid direction
        Ensures
        0 < index && index <= 6

      • moveChecker

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> moveChecker​(int i1,
                                                          int i2,
                                                          int i3,
                                                          int i4,
                                                          int i5,
                                                          java.lang.String direction)

        adds the given indexs to an arraylist, sorts them and finalizes the list by adding hidden summito marbles when a player enters less than the total amount of marbles to be moved. Finally the full list is compared to valid moves and sends back all the marbles that should be moved.
        Parameters:
        i1 - the first index as input
        i2 - the second index as input
        i3 - the third index as input
        i4 - the fourth index as input
        i5 - the fifth index as input
        direction - the direction as input
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with valid moves
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if the index is not on board
        Requires
        i1, i2, i3, i4, i5 != null, direction is a valid direction
        Ensures
        0 < index && index <= 6

      • moveChecker

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> moveChecker​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> index,
                                                          java.lang.String direction)
                                                   throws IllegalMoveException
        adds the given indexs to an arraylist, sorts them and finalizes the list by adding hidden summito marbles when a player enters less than the total amount of marbles to be moved. Finally the full list is compared to valid moves and sends back all the marbles that should be moved.
        Parameters:
        index - an ArrayList with the indexes as given input
        direction - the direction as a valid input
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with valid moves
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if ArrayList.size() < 1 || ArrayList.size() > 5
        Requires
        index.get(i) != null, direction is a valid direction

                                                   throws IllegalMoveException
        checks if the indexes in the complete input list are a valid move.
        Parameters:
        index - the complete list of indexes
        direction - the given direction
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with all valid indexes to be moved.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - when the move is not valid

        public boolean isOnBoard​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> index)
        Checks if all indexes in the ArrayList are between 16 and 104.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • flipList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> flipList​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> index,
                                                       java.lang.String direction)
        Reverses the list to get the front marble on index 0 for the direction west, northwest or northeast.
        Parameters:
        index - the indexes as an input
        direction - the direction as an input
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with reversed order for Directions.west, Directions.northWest or Directions.northEast

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation​(java.lang.String direction)
        1 if orientation is NW or SE 2 if orientation is NE or SW 3 if orientation is E or W if something goes wrong return 9999.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction as input
        Returns:
        the orientation for a given direction

      • isValidSideStep

        public boolean isValidSideStep​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> index,
                               java.lang.String direction)
        Checks if all indexes in the given direction are empty, given that != isStraightMove().
        Parameters:
        index - the indexes as input
        direction - the direction as input
        Returns:
        true if one index in given direction != empty, else true
        Requires
        direction is valid direction
